duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform technical and mechanical work, ensuring the physical aspects of the property meet standards for cleanliness, appearance, safety, and functionality.
Complete work orders for resident service requests and preventative maintenance, diagnosing defects and making repairs according to policies and safety standards.
Prepare vacant apartment homes for leasing by completing inspections, maintenance tasks, and scheduling vendors as needed.
Maintain grounds, common areas, and amenities by performing general cleaning, painting, and debris removal.
Support cost-cutting and expense control programs by fixing rather than replacing parts, practicing correct use of tools and equipment.
Conduct routine and periodic property inspections to identify safety and risk management concerns and communicate property needs to management.
Comply with safety and risk-management policies, complete required safety training, and report accidents and incidents promptly.
Obtain necessary certifications and licenses as required for the role.

education_certification.credential: EPA certifications Type 1 and II or Universal for refrigerant recycling. (Applies to Certified Service Technicians.)
Valid driver’s license to operate a golf cart on property.
